name: NH Stephanie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: At 128euros for a 3 night break (double room with breakfast) this has to be one of the best value hotels in Brussels. For some, it might be a bit out from the centre but it's just a 3-4 minute walk from the Louisa metro stop.
reviews.title: Exceptional value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not particualrly big but it is tucked away down a quiet side street. Although the bedrooms (generous in size) and the public areas are maybe showing signs of being a little dated, it's a welcoming place - and clean throughout.
reviews.title: would definitely recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast is OK but nothing special. My only gripe would be with the internet access in the lobby. At 35c per minute it's not expensive but most smart hotels are now offering this service for free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a good choice and a bargain too.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I choose NH Stephanie because of the positive comments on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Our room was unexpectedly large and trendy. The staff was helpful and friendly, they even sent up a bottle of wine after check-in since they noticed (from my passport) that it was my birthday, a gesture they did not have to do. It is also very well situated and within walking distance to practically everything.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel when on business in Brussels. I'd never stayed before and decided to give it a try. It's fine, nothing special but for my purposes was totally in the wrong part of town (back to the Stanhope I go...)
reviews.title: Ok hotel but nothing special...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were fine and everything I needed was there. I was on the second floor and found the room very noisy...from an early time of the morning so not too much chance of a good night sleep. Tried to order a cab to the office in the morning and was told it would be a 60 mins wait...told it was a "short" walk...we obviously have a different understanding of "short" but it was sunny and a nice walk nonetheless.
reviews.title: I wouldn't say it is four star quality, but it's a fairly nice place, I suppose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything else was fine, if you looking for a cheaper alternative to some of the larger chains then I won't dispute that this does the job...
reviews.title: I would have given it 5 stars but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NH Stephanie has it's good and bad points. It's not too far from the centre of Brussels, there was a good selection at breakfast and the staff were quite nice. On the downside our "double room" had two single beds pushed together which were on wheels, but with two separate doonas so I'm not sure what they were aiming for with that but the beds split apart with the slightest movement and the doona was literally the exact size of the bed so not much to snuggle into - I've never seen that before.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The TV is old and the remote is hard to use as the buttons are fairly unresponsive.
reviews.title: Good standard chain hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Went with four friends for a bit of a belgian beer week-end. The man on reception on arrival seemed to be expecting us and was more than friendly and helpful. Ventured towards Grand Place area that evening, took about 20 minutes. Did most of the excellent bars in my beer guide. Had a great time and my terrible 'O' level french was not needed as everyone spoke perfect english. Took us about 2 hours to get back to the hotel, but that belgian beer is strong! Now we know exactly where it is located we would not hesitate to go their again. We had the 80 euro week-end rate including the breakfast and mini bar, would certainly go for that again. A lot of people say Brussels is a bit boring. So get yourself a beer guide and meet lots of interesting local people, very friendly. Looking for an occasion to return soon.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in quiet area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is in the Charleroi location in Brussels, just by the trendy Louise square. It is a bit hidden from the main road and it can be confused with another NH property about 200 yards on the same road. However, the hotel is cozy, definately upgraded with modern furniture and appliances. The hotel employees were very helpful and they had a great sense of humour. There is a buffet type breakfast, although a bit pricey (15 euros per person), but the selection was large and tasty. We liked the coffee, which had nothing to do with the typical filtered juice one faces at other hotels.
reviews.title: Hidden treasure in the middle of Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Going to the Samblon and th Grand Place from the hotel was a breeze. The metro station Louise is 5 minutes walk from the hotel and the Gare du Midi train station a 10 minute ride. This is definately a location to keep in mind when visiting Brussels.
reviews.title: NH Stephanie - lives up to it's excellent reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: As good as the recent reviews!! Located in a good part of Brussels with excellent transport to other areas. The centre and most places of interest are within walking distance. The hotel itself is situate just off the main street and very easily found from the nearest tube station. Upon arrival the staff were helpful and kept this cordiality up the whole of our short stay. Very clean and adequate rooms offering up to date facilities. A good central (and very quiet at night!) hotel. Would recomment to both business and tourists.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed the two nights I stayed in the NH Stephanie. It was clean and comfortable and the room was a good size. The weekend deal with the breakfast and mini-bar included was nice. There was more in the mini-bar than I expected. Breakfast was OK, but since it was included with the rate that was fine. I would not pay extra for it.
reviews.title: Perfectly OK, but no WOW factor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at February 2011 in superior double room. As a plus I could note good location closed to shopping streets and tube station, very comfortable bed and a quite street on wich the hotel is located.
reviews.title: Not a 4* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Air condition in our room didn't work, bathroom is ridiculously small and uncomfortable, the hotel staff didn't change towels and didn't replenish shampoo and shower gel. Breakfast is poor for 4* hotel. I noticed only one socket in the room, so you need to recharge your gadgets one by one and use your hairdryer without mirror as you can't use the bathroom's socket for it. As a 3* hotel it will be good and the price will be fair.
reviews.title: Ruhige Lage, sehr komfortables Bett, aber nur 30 Minuten gratis Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spaciaous room, very comfortable bed. Location two blocks from Louise Metro near Shopping and restaurants. Only 30 minutes free internet. Breakfast: nice variety of food, but alwys only small amounts - hence you either go without your müsli or wait until it is restocked. Hotel is in good neighborhood. Many restaurants nearby as well as shopping.
reviews.title: For the price, you can't beat this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a nice hotel at a great price, the NH Stephanie is a safe bet. The city centre is within walking distance or you can take the Metro. The Metro is also close to the Eurostar station, if you are coming in that way. The area where the property is located is quite and there are several pubs/restaurants located close by. The rooms are simple and clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, the NH Stephanie was a great deal for the price.
reviews.title: Christmas getaway

description: Mid-rise hotel in excellent location near the Place Louise, 2 km from Midi station & 15 km from airport.
